definition: to find a place where one can fit in/to make one's home/to seek shelter
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: The Lord has provided me shelter and purpose in my life.
sentences.chinese: 主赐予我容身之处，为我的生命注入意义。

sentences.english: Think of your shelter roof as being shingled like a house.
sentences.chinese: 把你的容身之处的屋顶看作是一间房子的叠瓦状。

sentences.english: I tried to find some place to hide but couldn't find any.
sentences.chinese: 我竭力想找一个地方躲起来，却无容身之地。

sentences.english: There is no world for escapists.
sentences.chinese: 这个世界决没有逃避主义者的容身之地。

definition: to make one's home/to take shelter
to stay for a time/to stop over/to lodge/to sink down (into soft ground)/leftovers
to hide/to go into hiding/to take refuge
to conceal oneself/to go into hiding/to take cover
life/to survive/to save a life/to scrape a living
to hide/to conceal and avoid (contact)/to keep sth concealed
to rely on sb for protection
